snippet.textDisplay: I’m currently a RN at a Chicago hospital . We are being told that caregivers wear a face mask, goggles or a face shield, a gown, and gloves unless you are in the room doing an aerosol-generated procedure. Aka N-95 not required for nasal swabs. Not sure I believe the recommendations when they also suggested to wear a bandanna.
snippet.textOriginal: I’m currently a RN at a Chicago hospital . snippet.textDisplay:
Your awesome for doing what you can during this craziness. Im still waiting for my fit test for the N95, I work with environmental services at a local hospital in Canada, we're the people who gear up, clean and disinfect a room with contagious diseases including Covid-19. We need these too but doctors and nurses are directly in contact with patients and we cant run out of these masks.
Thank you for doing everything you can to help!
snippet.textOriginal:
Your awesome for doing what you can during this craziness.  Im still waiting for my fit test for the N95, I work with environmental services at a local hospital in Canada, we're the people who gear up, clean and disinfect a room with contagious diseases including Covid-19.  We need these too but doctors and nurses are directly in contact with patients and we cant run out of these masks. 
Thank you for doing everything you can to help!

snippet.textDisplay: If surgical masks are so 'inefficient' then why do testing facilities need them? You said yourself your going to a testing site with the right PPE which had no masks on including n-95 but only face shields and PPE clothing. If PPE should only be for doctors then why is personal inside the name of PPE not associated with only doctors, or in this case, people in the front lines? There are Tons of data that conclude that masks are useful and do protect others from you if you have a respiratory illness, hence the reason why they were invented, so why is so bad that the general public have access to their own PPE gear? Why didnt the hospitals stock up on masks years before this pandemic or when it was confirmed? Hospitals charge 700$ for saline bags that cost 1$ to make and they couldn't stock up? Hospitals had every chance to prepare but what caused this problem to occur? Our government. Yes its obvious that doctors and nurses need it to treat patients but you, Dr.Mike, said yourself that surgical masks and just like the WHO, CDC, and CCP stated that even n-95 masks are ineffective then why are you buying them unless they are useful? More than 1700 health care workers in china got infected(confirmed) with high quality PPE gear. If face shields are more useful than masks then why are you buying masks?  My mom works in dentistry field but no one official, high or low, has talked about the dentists and their employees and how they are at risk treating patients with only a surgical mask. Your literally a foot or less away from their mouths which if infected could infect you through the eyes so how our dentists and dental assistants less important when they are equally at risk? Tell me, are they foolish for useing surgical masks since they are considered ineffective because hospitals need them? I really dont understand what's the big deal with masks. Obviously if your healthy your not gonna spread an illness around because you never had that illness to begin with but that dosent mean you or someone sick shouldnt wear it. Honk Kong just proved this by eliminating their flu cases and covid 19 cases to nearly 0 by EVERYONE wearing a mask but in america your not even allowed to wear one without causing 'fear' or ridiculed by everyone around you. I'm no psychologist but thats negative reinforcement and thats especially isnt helpful when a pandemic is going on.

snippet.textDisplay: Dr. Mike, this almost seems like a lie! Everyone keeps saying that not everyone needs to be tested and I get that. I've been sick for a month and a half, been to the ER twice, seen 4 doctors and been prescribed over 7 medications and nothing has gotten me better and no one tells me anything. I have all the symptoms and been turned down to get tested. My tests for influenza and pneumonia came back negative but they didn't test for COVID. I know of someone who has had a fever for 18 days and with the same symptoms and went to the ER twice, was sent home and told to rest. She asked to be tested and they said no. Some days I feel I'm getting better and then end up getting worse. It seems like I need to show up with my guts in my hand for them to take you seriously. Yet, they are testing celebrities and athletes left and right even though they don't say they have any symptoms.....
snippet.textOriginal: Dr. Mike, this almost seems like a lie! Everyone keeps saying that not everyone needs to be tested and I get that. I've been sick for a month and a half, been to the ER twice, seen 4 doctors and been prescribed over 7 medications and nothing has gotten me better and no one tells me anything. I have all the symptoms and been turned down to get tested. My tests for influenza and pneumonia came back negative but they didn't test for COVID. I know of someone who has had a fever for 18 days and with the same symptoms and went to the ER twice, was sent home and told to rest. She asked to be tested and they said no. Some days I feel I'm getting better and then end up getting worse. It seems like I need to show up with my guts in my hand for them to take you seriously. Yet, they are testing celebrities and athletes left and right even though they don't say they have any symptoms.....

snippet.textDisplay:
I currently work at Uhaul. Hopefully they gave you a good price! 20" box trucks (depending on mileage) can run high. Uhaul is also disinfecting ALL returns. (Everywhere a customer(s) will be touching). We are also washing our hands for 20 seconds after everything that requires said action. There will also be a question asked upon every receive, to the affect of: "Are you aware of anyone that has come into contact with this equipment that may have COVID-19?"

Keep up being awesome and I hope you are managing well!
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: There is a growing number of folks and those of your generation that feel like the different states and counties that are doing emergency stay at home orders are doing more harm than good.  I know you know and I know full well the assumption that we just some how do business as usual, let this virus run through the population and cull the herd of old and sick people is somehow a better situation than the lives lost due to slamming a sector of the economy to a halt.  In a social media forums this is a growing sentiment, speak to this insanity, that is that this is just a flu virus we should let run through society to cull the herd, that it will only affect the old and sick and that somehow we will be better off if we do than the economic disaster of sheltering in place.

snippet.textDisplay:
@Doctor Mike, few questions -
1) Can this virus spread through a) clothes and b) food? If so, what to do?
2) Some service holders are wearing surgical gloves in huge discomfort as their workplace is open. Does it help? Does wearing cotton gloves help?
3) Can this virus, no matter how lowly probable, spread through a) air and b) water?
4) Few people are covering their eyes too, with sunglasses if they don't wear spectacles. Does it help?
snippet.textOriginal:
@Doctor Mike, few questions -
1) Can this virus spread through a) clothes and b) food? If so, what to do?
2) Some service holders are wearing surgical gloves in huge discomfort as their workplace is open. Does it help? Does wearing cotton gloves help?
3) Can this virus, no matter how lowly probable, spread through a) air and b) water?
4) Few people are covering their eyes too, with sunglasses if they don't wear spectacles. Does it help?

snippet.textDisplay: Dr. Mike, you're brave man! Thank you for taking such a big risk like this to help however you can. What do you think about donating the last $20,000 to  Americorps of Illinois or Illinois Health and Hospital Association? We were recently put under a statewide "shelter in place", lockdown order. The number of cases here raises significantly every day and it is so difficult for people to get tested, even if they present symptoms, have travel history, or exposure to another confirmed positive case. A new case was just reported in the county next to mine and we have been given little information as to where the person has been recently so we're worried about more cases popping up around home. I think the shortage of testing down here (southern IL) is due to PPE shortage, just like you say. Both IHHA and Americorps IL is accepting donations of PPE but I'm sure they could use the money well to help the AMAZING doctors, nurses, first responders, etc. fight COVID-19. Love ya Doc! Keep up the fantastic work

Keep up the fantastic work
